czbi_da_parez¶

czbi_da_parez¶

A Python package for data processing and analysis in channel and feature analysis.

processing¶

czbi_da_parez.processing.analyze_bright_spots(image_path, verbose=False, vis=False)¶

Analyzes bright spots in the membrane channel of the image.

Parameters:

image_path – Path to the image file.

czbi_da_parez.processing.analyze_membrane_continuity(image, mask)¶

Computes various metrics to assess membrane continuity.

Parameters:

  • image – The original membrane channel image.

  • mask – The binary mask of the cleaned membrane.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the computed metrics.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

czbi_da_parez.processing.count_nuclei_under_membrane(nuclei_labels, membrane_mask)¶

Counts the number of nuclei under the membrane.

Parameters:

  • nuclei_labels – Labeled nuclei image.

  • membrane_mask – Binary mask of the membrane.

Returns:

Number of nuclei under the membrane.

Return type:

int

czbi_da_parez.processing.create_mask_from_labels(labels)¶

Creates a binary mask from a label image.

Parameters:

labels – A 2D numpy array representing the label image.

Returns:

Binary mask.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

czbi_da_parez.processing.detect_boundary(image_path, vis=False)¶

Detects the boundary of the membrane in the image.

Parameters:

image_path – Path to the image file.

czbi_da_parez.processing.detect_boundary_wider(image_path, vis=False)¶

Detects the boundary of the membrane in the image (wider version).

Parameters:

image_path – Path to the image file.

czbi_da_parez.processing.format_data_to_dataframe(data)¶

Converts a specific data structure (list of tuples with nested region data and numpy arrays) into a pandas DataFrame with column headers representing the step, region, and percentile, and numerical values all in a single row.

Parameters:

data –

A list of tuples. Each tuple contains: - An integer representing the step (e.g., 60, 120). - A list of tuples. Each inner tuple contains:

  • An integer representing the region ID (e.g., 1, 2).

  • A numpy array of four floats representing the 25th, 50th, 75th, and 95th percentiles.

Returns:

A DataFrame with columns like ‘Step_X_Region_Y_25th’, ‘Step_X_Region_Y_50th’, etc., and numerical values in a single row.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

czbi_da_parez.processing.gradient_analysis(image_path, verbose=False, vis=False)¶

Analyzes the gradient of the membrane channel and returns bright spots.

Parameters:

image_path (str) – Path to the image file.

Returns:

Brightness values for each expansion step.

Return type:

list

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_info(image_path)¶

Get image size and number of channels.

Parameters:

image_path (str) – Path to the image file.

Returns:

Image size and number of channels.

Return type:

tuple

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_th_ch1(image)¶

Processes channel 1 of the image using StarDist2D model.

Parameters:

image – The input image.

Returns:

Labeled image, None, and binary mask.

Return type:

tuple

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_th_ch2(image)¶

Processes channel 2 of the image using Gaussian blur and Otsu thresholding.

Parameters:

image – The input image.

Returns:

Labeled image, blurred image, and thresholded image.

Return type:

tuple

czbi_da_parez.processing.measure_brightness_variability(intensity_image, mask)¶

Measures the variability of brightness values under a mask.

Parameters:

  • intensity_image – The image containing brightness values.

  • mask – A binary mask where 1 indicates the region of interest.

Returns:

Brightness variability metrics (e.g., standard deviation).

Return type:

dict

czbi_da_parez.processing.measure_image(label_image, intensity_image, properties)¶

Measures image properties using regionprops_table.

Parameters:

  • label_image – Labeled image.

  • intensity_image – Intensity image.

  • properties – List of properties to measure.

Returns:

DataFrame of measured properties.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

czbi_da_parez.processing.measure_membrane_pixel_count(label_image)¶

Measures the total pixel count of the membrane regions.

Parameters:

label_image – Labeled image of membranes.

Returns:

Total pixel count of membrane regions.

Return type:

int

czbi_da_parez.processing.measure_membrane_thickness(label_image, intensity_image)¶

Measures membrane thickness statistics (median, min, max).

Parameters:

  • label_image – Labeled image of membranes.

  • intensity_image – The original intensity image.

Returns:

Median, minimum, and maximum thickness values.

Return type:

dict

czbi_da_parez.processing.normalize(image)¶

Normalizes the image intensity to the range [0, 1].

czbi_da_parez.processing.percentage_nuclei_pixels(nuclei_labels, membrane_mask)¶

Calculates the percentage of nuclei pixels within the membrane.

Parameters:

  • nuclei_labels – Labeled nuclei image.

  • membrane_mask – Binary mask of the membrane.

Returns:

Percentage of nuclei pixels within the membrane.

Return type:

float

czbi_da_parez.processing.plot_normalized_channels(channel_1, channel_2)¶

Plots the normalized channels.

Parameters:

  • channel_1 – The first image channel (e.g., nuclei).

  • channel_2 – The second image channel (e.g., membrane).

czbi_da_parez.processing.prep_for_membrane_analysis(image_path, vis=False)¶

Prepares the membrane channel for analysis by thresholding and cleaning.

Parameters:

  • image_path – Path to the image file.

  • vis (bool) – Whether to visualize the results.

Returns:

Membrane channel and cleaned membrane mask.

Return type:

tuple

czbi_da_parez.processing.process_imag_old(image_path)¶

Processes an image and returns information about it (legacy version).

Parameters:

image_path – The path to the image file.

Returns:

summary_df_ch1, summary_df_ch2, specific_df as statistical summary

czbi_da_parez.processing.process_image(image_path, verbose=False)¶

Processes an image and returns information about it.

Parameters:

  • image_path – The path to the image file.

  • verbose (bool) – Whether to print debug information.

Returns:

summary_df_ch1, summary_df_ch2, specific_df as statistical summary

czbi_da_parez.processing.process_images_in_subfolders(root_folder)¶

Processes all images in subfolders and returns a DataFrame with results.

Parameters:

root_folder – Path to the root folder containing images.

Returns:

DataFrame with results.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

czbi_da_parez.processing.save_label_mask(image_path, labels, output_folder)¶

Saves the label image and mask as TIFF files in the specified folder.

Parameters:

  • image_path (str) – Path to the input image.

  • labels (numpy.ndarray) – Label image data.

  • output_folder (str) – Path to the output folder.

czbi_da_parez.processing.summarize_features(df)¶

Calculates summary statistics for a DataFrame and returns a new DataFrame with one row.

Parameters:

df – Input DataFrame.

Returns:

DataFrame with summary statistics.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

utilities¶

utilities¶

Helper functions and notebook utilities.

quality.py¶

Quality checking utilities for image datasets.

Classes:

QualityChecker: Provides methods for checking image paths and directory structure.

class czbi_da_parez.utilities.quality.QualityChecker¶

Bases: object

Provides methods for checking image paths and directory structure.

static check_image_paths(df: DataFrame, image_path_column: str) → None¶

Checks if image paths in a DataFrame column exist.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the image paths.

  • image_path_column (str) – Name of the column containing image paths.

static image_info(image_path: str)¶

Get image size, number of channels, and pixel size (if available).

Parameters:

image_path (str) – Path to the image file.

Returns:

(image_size, num_channels, pixel_size_nm)

Return type:

tuple

static print_directory_tree(root_dir: str, indent: int = 0) → None¶

Prints a directory tree starting from the given root directory.

Parameters:

  • root_dir (str) – Root directory to print.

  • indent (int) – Indentation level (used internally).

ipynb_helper.py¶

Helper functions for working with Jupyter Notebooks.

Provides methods for converting Jupyter Notebooks to Python scripts.

Convert a Jupyter Notebook (.ipynb) file to a Python (.py) script.

Parameters:

  • ipynb_file (str) – The path to the input .ipynb file.

  • py_file (str) – The path to the output .py file.

static find_todos_in_notebook(notebook_content: dict) → None¶

Finds and summarizes TODOs in a Jupyter Notebook’s text and code cells.

Parameters:

notebook_content (dict) – The notebook content as a dictionary.

static ipynb_todo_check(path: str, notebook_name: str) → None¶

Reads a Jupyter Notebook file and checks for TODOs in its cells.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path to the folder containing the notebook.

  • notebook_name (str) – Name of the notebook file.
